alert.note: Alert for McKenzie; Williams (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 3:24PM CDT until further notice by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Bismarck ND has issued a Flood Warning for the Missouri River near Williston affecting Williams and McKenzie Counties... .Due to rapid melting of snow in the mountains of Montana, a surge of water will cause minor flooding along the Yellowstone and Missouri Rivers near Williston. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Missouri River near Williston. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Ditches in the vicinity of the river will fill and wildlife management lands along the south banks will begin to flood. At 22.0 feet, Low-lying farmland and access roads to oil well sites near Trenton are flooded. City of Williston does not flood. At 24.0 feet, Water begins to cover oil well location south and east of Williston. Wildlife management areas are flooded. City of Williston does not flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM CDT Monday /1:45 PM MDT Monday/ the stage was 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Wednesday evening and continue rising to a crest near 24 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 30.4 feet on 06/21/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
